abstract.p: A Perron number is a real algebraic integer α of degree d ≥ 2, whose conjugates are α i , such that $\alpha >\text{max}_{2\leq i\leq d}|\alpha _{i}|$ . In this paper we compute the smallest Perron numbers of degree d ≤ 24 and verify that they all satisfy the Lind-Boyd conjecture. Moreover, the smallest Perron numbers of degree 17 and 23 give the smallest house for these degrees. The computations use a family of explicit auxiliary functions. These functions depend on generalizations of the integer transfinite diameter of some compact sets in ℂ
